_exec_summary.SummaryText:
RMP Level III Propane Storage Facility

Gas Supply Resources - Berlin Terminal

Parent Company - NGL Energy Partners LP

EPA Facility Identifier #  1000 0017 7505



EXECUTIVE SUMMARY



The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at the Berlin Terminal facility:

NGL Supply Terminal Company is committed to the safety of its workers, the public, and the environment. Its accidental release policy is an integrated approach, involving employee participation, management practices, written procedures, and training. NGL has developed a comprehensive Liquefied Petroleum Gas (LPG) accident prevention program considering all aspects of process operation and maintenance. The accident prevention program includes compliance with ongoing mechanical integrity inspections, which includes the API RP 510 Pressure Vessel Inspection Program and API RP 570 Piping Inspection Program. In addition, the facility conducts 3-year PSM compliance audits. If an emergency were to occur, it is NGL's policy to notify the Berlin Fire Department and request that they respond to the emergency. This facility also maintains incipient stage fire-fighting equipment on site. Additionally, this facility complies with NFPA-58 requirements for LPG storage, and it is NGL's policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state, and local laws.

A description of the Berlin Terminal facility and the regulated substances handled:

This facility is a bulk terminal storing LPG for resale to retail propane dealers. The facility consists of one (2) 60,000-gallon storage tank holding approximately 230,000 pounds of liquid propane. There is also the capacity for eight (10) 33,000-gallon rail cars onsite and two (2) 14,500-gallon trucks. There are both manual and automatic emergency shutdown systems on all LPG equipment at the site.

The general accidental release prevention program and chemical-specific prevention steps:

This facility complies with EPA's accident prevention rule, the OSHA PSM standar

d, and all applicable state and local codes and regulations. The LPG system is designed, installed, and maintained in accordance with NFPA-58 and state law.

Five-year accident history:

NGL Supply Terminal Company purchased the facility in 2019. There has not been an accident involving LPG that caused deaths, injuries, property or environmental damage, evacuations, or any shelter in place.

The emergency response program:

NGL Supply Terminal Company has developed an emergency action plan specific to this facility. In the event of an emergency involving the Terminal's LPG system, it is NGL's policy to notify the Berlin Fire Department and request that they help in responding to the emergency. NGL has trained employees in incipient stage firefighting. This terminal has coordinated the facility's response plans with the LEPC & fire department; members of the LEPC & fire department have been provided the opportunity to visit the facility and inspect the LPG storage system.

Planned changes to improve safety:

NGL Supply Terminal Company, LLC will continually strive for safety improvement. Periodic process safety inspections and Process Hazard Analyses will be conducted followed with timely response.  NGL shares Lessons Learned from other similar facilities as appropriate to prevent similar incidents.
